revised_title: Deep Etching of Rat Neuromuscular Junction Acetylcholine Receptors
tldr: The authors used deep etching and freeze-fracture techniques to study the true external surface of the postsynaptic membrane at the rat neuromuscular junction. They discovered a densely packed population of protrusions about 8.5 nm in diameter, which are mainly confined to the postsynaptic regions of the sarcolemma and are likely the acetylcholine receptor molecules. The protrusions are generally tightly packed without an obvious regular arrangement, but in some areas, they form irregular rows perpendicular to the fold's axis.
